speaker: Bernard Wojciechowski (IND/DEM),
english: Bernard Wojciechowski (IND/DEM), in writing . – According to Eurostat data, Croatian GDP per capita stands at 53 per cent of the EU average. Croatia's GDP growth is at 6 percent. Clearly its GDP per capita is higher than Romania and Bulgaria and in all honesty, it is a shame that Croatia was not given the opportunity to join the European Union with Romania and Bulgaria. Over the centuries, Croatia has contributed many things to the cultural landscape of our continent. Let us make sure that we do not hinder its development and ensure that it does not have to wait longer than 2009 to become a Member State.
original: Bernard Wojciechowski (IND/DEM), in writing . – According to Eurostat data, Croatian GDP per capita stands at 53 per cent of the EU average. Croatia's GDP growth is at 6 percent. Clearly its GDP per capita is higher than Romania and Bulgaria and in all honesty, it is a shame that Croatia was not given the opportunity to join the European Union with Romania and Bulgaria. Over the centuries, Croatia has contributed many things to the cultural landscape of our continent. Let us make sure that we do not hinder its development and ensure that it does not have to wait longer than 2009 to become a Member State.
agenda_item: Croatia: 2007 progress report - Progress Report on the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia (debate)
